intro: Stachytarpheta jamaicensis f. albiflora, commonly known as whiteflower shrub or white stachy. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Verbenaceae family, characterized by its compact shrub form and showy, white to pale blue flowers. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. This cultivar is valued for its ornamental appeal and is commonly used in landscaping and garden design.
